definition: to have a foot in both camps/to have a bet each way/to be having an affair
foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
to tread/to stamp/to step on/to press a pedal/to investigate on the spot
two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)
classifier for birds and certain animals, one of a pair, some utensils, vessels etc

sentences.english: You have been two-timing for some time.
sentences.chinese: 你腳踏兩隻船已經很久了。

sentences.english: Are you sure he is not two-timing you?
sentences.chinese: 你確定他沒有腳踏兩隻船？

sentences.english: You can double date and mess with your ex-girlfriend's best friend.
sentences.chinese: 你可以腳踏兩隻船，跟你前女友的最好的朋友亂搞。

sentences.english: I dumped her because she two-timed me.
sentences.chinese: 她腳踏兩隻船，我就和她吹了。

sentences.english: Xia Tong found two people close to warn both consequences.
sentences.chinese: 夏彤發現了二人關係親密，警告段腳踏兩隻船的後果。

sentences.english: Martin is really a playboy, he’s dating two girls at the same time.
sentences.chinese: 馬丁真是個花花公子，他腳踏兩隻船。
